question: What is the white mutation in Drosophila affecting?
ideal_answer: Βeyond the classical eye-color phenotype, mutations in Drosophila white gene could impair several biological functions affecting parameters like mobility, life span and stress tolerance.

snippets.text: The classic eye-color gene white (w) in Drosophila melanogaster (fruitfly) has unexpected behavioral consequences.

We conclude that beyond the classical eye-color phenotype, mutations in Drosophila white gene could impair several biological functions affecting parameters like mobility, life span and stress tolerance.
